intro: Jatropha dalechampiiformis, commonly known as the Mexican physic nut, is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a toxic, sticky substance. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically used for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
